title: 1.048 EFFECT OF REPEAL OF CERTAIN LAWS.
text: Mason's Minnesota Statutes of 1927, sections 4 and 5, as amended by Laws 1941, chapter 66, and Mason's Minnesota Statutes of 1927, Sections 6, 6-2, 6-3, 6-4, 6-5, and 6-6, and Mason's Supplement 1940, Section 6-1, are repealed, but their repeal shall not affect any case in which the consent of the state to the acquisition of property or the exercise of jurisdiction by the United States was given by any of them and the acquisition of the property was completed before the taking effect of Laws 1943, chapter 343, nor any case in which the consent of the state was given by Laws 1941, chapter 66, before the taking effect of Laws 1943, chapter 343.

==: Mason's Minnesota Statutes of 1927, sections 4 and 5, as amended by Laws 1941, chapter 66

examples.consent_given_by: Mason's Minnesota Statutes of 1927, sections 4 and 5, as amended by Laws 1941, chapter 66
Mason's Minnesota Statutes of 1927, sections 6, 6-2, 6-3, 6-4, 6-5, and 6-6

variables.name: consent_given_by
variables.description: The legal statute or law by which the state's consent was given for property acquisition or jurisdiction.

variables.name: acquisition_date
variables.description: The date on which the acquisition of the property was completed.

variables.name: consent_date
variables.description: The date on which the state's consent was given.

consequences: The repeal does not affect the case.
